Package tage.networking

Class AbstractGameConnection

java.lang.Object
tage.networking.AbstractGameConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGameConnection
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractGameConnectionClient, AbstractGameConnectionServer
public abstract class AbstractGameConnection extends Object implements IGameConnection
A general abstract class to implement methods not specific to a game connection.
Author:
Kyle Matz Modified from the SAGE Networking package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Ported to TAGE by Scott Gordon.

  • Method Details

    • getLocalInetAddress

      public InetAddress getLocalInetAddress() throws UnknownHostException
      A method to get the local IP address. This will return the default IP; meaning if the machine is connected to more than one network the returned IP address could be different than the one the user wishes to use. See InetAddress.getLocalHost() for the return value.
      Specified by:
      getLocalInetAddress in interface IGameConnection
      Returns:
      the default local address
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException

    • getAllLocalAddress

      public Collection<InetAddress> getAllLocalAddress() throws SocketException
      Retrieves ALL of IP addresses for the local machine. This is intended to be used when connected to several networks as getLocalInetAddress() may return a different address than the one desired.
      Specified by:
      getAllLocalAddress in interface IGameConnection
      Returns:
      a collection of all of the local InetAddresses
      Throws:
      SocketException
